Class PlayerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
      • PlayerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonEvent, onNeedsBetListener

    public class PlayerController
extends Player
implements ButtonEvent
    The player controller will handle connecting the visual and data layers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerController

        public PlayerController(int id,
                        int startingCash,
                        Table table,
                        Sketch sketch)
        Default Constructor.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the player.
        startingCash - How much cash the player starts with.
        table - The table that is constructing this controller. Used for synchronization and restarting the table thread.
        sketch - The sketch that the table has.

    • Method Detail

      • onNeedsBet

        public int onNeedsBet(int minBet,
                      boolean forced)
        Description copied from interface: onNeedsBetListener
        Tells the player to return the bet they will make.
        Specified by:
        onNeedsBet in interface onNeedsBetListener
        Overrides:
        onNeedsBet in class Player
        Parameters:
        minBet - The minimum bet the player must make.
        forced - If true, the player must give exactly the provided minBet.
        Returns:
        Returns -1 if the player is folding. Otherwise, it will return the amount the player is betting.

      • createGUI

        public void createGUI(int minBet,
                      boolean forced)
        Creates the GUI to allow user input
        Parameters:
        minBet - The minimum bet the player must make
        forced - If true, then the player must make exactly the minimum bet or fold.
        See Also:
        onNeedsBetListener

        public void onButtonEvent(java.lang.String name)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the button that called this event
